Informatica MDM BPM SDK

 

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.informatica.mdm.bpm
Base package for the BPM adapter SDK.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.data
Default implementation of data interfaces that can be used across adapters.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.enumeration
Enumerations used in the adapter SDK.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.idd
IDD-specific implementations of the data interfaces in the SDK.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.interfaces
Provides the adapter interfaces to communicate with a BPM engine.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.interfaces.data
Provides the interfaces for all task-related data used in the SDK.
com.informatica.mdm.bpm.interfaces.taskdef  

The BPM Adapter SDK is comprised of interfaces and classes that can be used by an application to communicate with a BPM engine.

To develop BPM Adapter implementations for Informatica Data Director (IDD), additional classes are available in the package com.informatica.mdm.bpm.idd. These are provided by IDD to pass application-specific data to and from the BPM adapters.

To develop BPM adapters for IDD using the SDK, the following need to be implemented:

  • An implementation of IBPMAdapter to provide workflow capabilities within IDD
  • An implementation of IBPMProcessGenerator to allow generation of merge tasks for match table records in the MDM Hub

In addition an application provider, for example IDD, will need to provide the following:

  • An implementation of ITaskData representing the task details
  • An implementation of ITaskRecord representing the task record
  • An implementation of ITaskDataPager to allow paging of tasks
  • An implementation of IApplicationContext to provide application specific details from the calling application to the adapter
The implementations of these interfaces for IDD are available in the com.informatica.mdm.bpm.idd package.
